website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful, functional pan nicely crafted by a top name in kitchen essentials. For cooks who prefer stainless steel cookware, it's a close contender for the best.
pros: Grabs attention with its sleek, stainless steel construction from handle to lid
Ideal size for most cooks at 5 1/2 quarts
cons: The downside of a stainless steel pan such as this model is that food is prone to sticking

customer_reviews.title: Define flat cooking surface..
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this pan except it has a hump in the middle, so pan frying is tricky. I read so many reviews saying it was “flat”, I decided to buy it. After viewing my images of the pan with a little milk in it, is this what is considered flat? Did I get a lemon? Is this pan normally flat?
customer_reviews.author: LOLson

customer_reviews.title: It warped
customer_reviews.text: Only have used it 2-3 times, while heating butter at a med low temp I noticed it warping, it raised up in the middle. It did not go away and is now worthless as it will not heat evenly now. I would not recommended this product at all! I should have paid attention to the negative reviews
customer_reviews.author: philwt

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan but bottom not flat
customer_reviews.text: Nice pan. It heated evenly but it appears the interior bottom is not totally flat. I noticed it when I poured about 2 tbs. of olive oil in the center and the olive oil distributed evenly towards the sides of the pan from the center. I guess I will have to use slightly more oil than anticipated. For that, I took off one star.
customer_reviews.author: Scubadave

customer_reviews.title: Teaching my Daughter-in-Law to Cook. 👩🏻‍🍳
customer_reviews.text: This Sauté Pan was a very nice size for a larger family. It also, cleans up easily. Although, it much lighter in weight than I expected. Basically, it was a pan that was marked down $100 originally being $140 so, I shouldn’t of expected that much . I bought it for my daughter-in-law because, she was “Eye-balling” my 5 Quart All Clad Sauté! (I told her, “I’d leave it to her in my will.” 🙄) Overall it’s a wonderful Sauté for a “Younger” cook or someone on a budget. Posted is my D-I-L’s first attempt at my “Zucchini, Ziti, Tomato & Mascarpone Pasta”. She had lots of fun and thanked me profusely for the gift. 👍🏼👵🏻
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the reviews that talk about it warping
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pan for a few months, and don't use it all that frequently. It's already developed a distinct crown in the bottom. It's great if you want to saute a bundt cake or a hemorrhoid pillow. For everything else, it's just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: SpoonOfFate

customer_reviews.title: Defective pan update
customer_reviews.text: Update: after contacting the company they sent me a replacement pan and lid free of charge As you can see from the photo there's a bulge in the middle of the pan. Easy to see with just a little water placed in the pan. We have only used the pan 3 times on an electric smooth top stove on medium heat
customer_reviews.author: James J Costello

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier, this is a great Sauté Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sauté pan that offers a ton of versatility in the kitchen. I was happily surprised when I first got the pan, you can just feel the quality when you pick it up. And for the price, it’s an incredible buy.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pan nearly daily for the last 4 years to feed my family of 6. It's held up well and is my all time favorite pan. It's huge, cooks well, cleans nice, and it's extremely versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration after using for first time
customer_reviews.text: I used the pan for first time and used medium low setting on my glass top stove...which is 3 setting. i cooked chuck steak with onions and it really came out good....the meat browned well. when i went to clean it - i soaked it for a while...but noticed alot of discoloration on the bottom..with alot of little black spots and cloudiness .....that i cannot remove ...i have been cooking for years on stainless and know not to use high settings...i am really disappointed that it did this. but...i am going to keep it and see how it does next time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Woods

customer_reviews.title: High Centered in first use
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful size, looks great. However after heating on medium until hot (using suggestion in other reviews i.e. check with drops of water) and cooking bacon, then eggs, i found that the pan was high centered. sheesh, no bueno! As for cleaning meh, soaked in liquid soap, and then washed out. still had residue - soaked again, and looked cloudy in places. Used vinegar as suggested in the instructions to really clean. Felt like this was more work than my cast iron and others.
customer_reviews.author: J Tupp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and HUGE 5 QUART Saute Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE Pan! It has a beautiful mirrored finish to the pan as well as to it's metal lid. For it's size, you'd expect to pay at least $200 or more. I bought a 3 qt saute pan from Made In costing $131 bucks & it didn't have a mirrored finish; the pan was stolen off my porch (thank goodness my bank refunded me). I took that refund & purchased this 5 qt saute pan from Amazon, that cost less AND was larger than that pan from Made In!! This was an EXCELLENT purchase!!! Thank you, Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this pan. Surprisingly easy to clean after a brief soaking, even tho there is a little bit of discoloration on the side, and I love not having to worry about a potentially unsafe material leaching into my food, like with nonstick pans. Large size makes it very useful in the kitchen and I’ve alreadyised it more than I would have thought. Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.author: myjanda

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite pan!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried because this pan was such a good price-but when it arrived I was very impressed with the heft and quality of this p an. It has quickly become my favorite pan in our kitchen! It is easy to clean, and cooks food evenly. Plus you don't have to worry about any toxic fumes since it is stainless steel (really important if you have birds in the house!). I recommend this for anyone who has a stove and a kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cooking surface is not flat
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning my second one. On both pans there is a bulge in the center of the pan so all the cooking oil runs to the outside edge of the pan leaving the center oil free.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Best pan in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the best pan I have ever bought. It is large enough to cook for a family up to 8 people in my experience. You will not run out of room on this pan. it is incredibly easy having a pan that will go from stovetop to stove with no problem. It is surprisingly easily to clean. I have made so many things in it and clean up is always easy. I would seriously buy this for anyone who cooks for more than two people on a regular basis. This is truly a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON E SACKS

customer_reviews.title: The newest addition
customer_reviews.text: My pots and pans must be at least 60 or 70 years old. This new sauce pan is a great addition. It is easy to clean and still looks new. The wife and I use it at least 3 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pan and food doesn’t stick.
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to switch from Teflon to stainless steel, but I made the switch and I’m so glad I did! I love this pan. It’s big enough to cook a whole pack of chicken breasts so they are not crowded. I watched some videos on you tube about cooking with stainless steel, that helped a lot. I have cooked eggs, sausage and chicken so far with no problems. This pan is so easy to clean! I love the size and the helper handle. If your looking for a sturdy sauté pan, this is a great one!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. Now this isn’t the worlds best pan, but for the money it is great. It has become one of my “go-to” Pans. I have cooked a lot in it and have yet to have too much difficulty cleaning it after. It says it is dishwasher safe, but I always hand wash it. If you’re in the market for a new sauté pan and don’t want to overspend, then this may be what you’re looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan! Very easy to clean and cook with. Pro tip - don’t touch the handle a minute after you remove it from a 425F oven 🤦‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: I love cooking with this cookware...
customer_reviews.text: I really like cooking with this pan... I use it all the time... My favorite thing is how even it heats up and cook's food... Just keep it at medium-low for cooking none liquid food... with this cookware it is perfect really. Clean-up is no problem under these temperatures... I always use a little bit of white vinegar when cleaning to keep out the hard water spots and remove the chalk looking marks left by cooking meats.
customer_reviews.author: Gnarly Ed

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves this product
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to fancy up veggies and this Cuisinart Chef Classic stainless saute pan is large, flat sided and comes with a lid. Great cooking product and cooks evenly. Bought this product over others so when I get an induction stove/oven I can use this pan.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new pan for my wife because we were hosting several family members for the holidays. The pan we received as used, re-boxed, and sold as a new pan.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Would you like a pot lid that doubles as a tambourine/cymbal combo
customer_reviews.text: Are you afraid of home invaders? Do you frequently find yourself making dishes that would not be appropriate in a stockpot nor in a skillet? Would you like a pot lid that doubles as a tambourine/cymbal combo? Then this is the pan for you! I have the skillet version of this pan and *love it*! I bought this pan because for larger dishes I needed something with a lot of surface area and a lid that would hold a lot of liquid, yet be open enough to let some liquid evaporate for browning/saute action on some onions. I have no doubt I'll get years of use out of this pan like I did with the skillet version.
customer_reviews.author: DrFrankenFluff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very sturdy, exactly what I wanted. I'd looked at more expensive versions of similar pans, but I'm glad I went with this one. It is all stainless steel, the heat spreads evenly on the bottom of the pan, and none of the handles get very hot even when it's been on the stove for awhile. It also comes clean pretty easily even though it is not non-stick, and an overnight soak in soapy water is all that's necessary to get any stuck on food off the pan. It may not last forever, but I'm confident that it'll last for quite a while. I'd recommend this pan to anyone looking for a good quality, large saute pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pan worthy of good food
customer_reviews.text: Heavy pan, great quality (like you'd expect from Cuisinart!) I actually like that it has a stainless steel lid instead of a glass top with the vent hole in it, so that I can control things a little better. The only largie saute pans I've had this size have been nonstick and it is next to impossible to brown food (since BROWN FOOD TASTES GOOD, as Anne Burrell would say) in them without the food overcooking. Not any more, with this wonderful stainless steel one.
customer_reviews.author: James F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: You can spend a lot more for a pan like this, but I seriously doubt that it would be a better saute pan!! Spreads heat evenly, looks great and cleans up easily! I would definitely recommend this pan! Unless of course you're out to impress someone with how much you spent?!
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, cooks super evenly, and very versatile. I've made everything from stir fry to soups in this. Looks beautiful too! Has held up well with use. Handles do stay cool even when the pan is incredibly hot.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Librae

customer_reviews.title: My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: It met all my expectations. I wanted a large pan with straight sides for preparing my chicken for chicken cacciatore. The large pan with straight sides allows me to cook more chicken and keep the stove cleaner. I generally make a double batch of sauce and freeze it. For reheat the lid allows me to simmer at higher temperature with freshly prepared chicken. The pan cleans up easily since it is non porous stainless steel, and it needed no seasoning. My wife who at first objected to another pan likes it also. So far all pluses.
customer_reviews.author: Ron De Luco

customer_reviews.title: Love this Beautiful Cuisinart 12" Pan
customer_reviews.text: I just received my beautiful Cuisinart 12" sauteeing pan today, 4/10/13. I washed and rinsed lid and pan, dried, and immediately placed on gas burner and heated up the pan on medium heat. Once heated, placed 1 tbsp oil then placed my 6 cups of chopped veggies. Within 10 mins. my veggies were done. Clean up was so easy and quick. My food tasted so nice. The pan has a good weight (6 lbs.) and heats very evenly. This is the first time in my cooking life I owned such a beautiful cooking appliance. Very happy and recommend to anyone to invest in this pan. Money will be very well spent.
customer_reviews.author: overenthusiast

customer_reviews.title: A great pan!
customer_reviews.text: As an All-Clad fan, I wanted a saute pan to match, but the price was off the scale. On the recommendation of a number of reviewers, I bought this pan and could not be happier, especially with a price of about a third of the All-Clad version. It is huge, and you can fry up a whole chicken in it with ease. It is deep enough for almost any task. My only cavil is that somoe saute pans come with a grease screen in addition to a cover, which would have been a nice touch. Sometimes you just want to avoid the "steaming" effect on food that a cover inevitably brings. But, that is a small complaint.
customer_reviews.author: David J. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Know your pans
customer_reviews.text: As long as you take care of the pan it will do its job. I use it all time. I have had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Fred V.

customer_reviews.title: First one wasnt flat.  Neither was the 2nd
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt flat when it arrived. A couple dents as well I returned for a replacement Replacement wasnt flat either I give up!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful pan. I love it and highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Ever since receiving this pan I cooked several meals and absolutely love it. I ended up buying a smaller version of the same pan. I highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Foss

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted in stainless saute pan.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pan, thick bottom for heat retention, easy to clean due to high quality finish, used and washed several times surface seems very durable as well. You buy a pan like this because you want to saute, make pan sauces, and often deglaze all that wonderful flavor for other purposes. Simply making gravy can destroy a pan, this one takes the abuse performs wonderfully and cleans up like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose pan
customer_reviews.text: Love this 5 1/2 quart pan. I cook almost everything in it. Whether it's frying onions or making soup, this pan works great. I've used it to cook meatloaf and cottage pie in the oven. I'd suggest getting a silicone pot holder for the handle and wearing an oven mitt when taking it out of the oven. The pan is so heavy, the heat will soak through both quite quickly when holding it. The handles do not get hot when on top of the stove. It also cleans up really nicely without too much effort. I like the metal lid too.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Large Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my beloved 1990s-vintage Revere Ware saute pan was damaged in a cooktop accident. The Cuisinart has slightly larger capacity than my old pan, and it's lighter. It distributes heat almost identically. The only drawback is that you can't use steel wool to clean it (at least, the manufacturer doesn't recommend it). That hasn't been a deal-breaker for me, but it would be nice if I could use brillo pads on it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This pan arrived exactly as pictured and described. The lid fits tightly and the handles are solid. The pan is heavy but not too heavy. The instructions clearly indicate that you are not meant to use this pan over very high heat on stoves or in ovens, and frankly you should not need to. I have it used it, no kidding, several dozen times since I bought it and I have yet to do any kind of scrubbing to get it back to like-new. I do a lot of cooking and while I can appreciate the advantage of using tri-ply etc. I don't think it's worth the extra expense. This is an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: The Frog

customer_reviews.title: love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: this pan is amazing! I have had zero issues with scratches or any warping. I use this almost every day and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan so, it's so easy to cook, clean, and make large pasta dishes in it.
customer_reviews.author: JL8

customer_reviews.title: Great pan.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We are a family of five so I needed a pan I can cook a lot of food at once. I dont put it in the dishwasher as per the reviews. Its very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: holes on cooking surface :(
customer_reviews.text: updating this review after less than a year. the coating is coming off the bottom of the pan. I have not had this for long and there are small black holes in the coating. really tiny holes but they are multiplying. i wish i could return. in fact if the seller is reading this I'd like to know to do that. this is supposed to last a long time. new update: threw it in garbage after previous update. the tiny holes at the bottom of the pan are multiplying and they are getting larger. who knows what type of metal is showing through. this is not acceptable from a company with such a name. they lost me as a client.
customer_reviews.author: blackcat

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart saute pan
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant after some reviews. It came with no dents, looks good, heats well and cleans up easily. Key is not to use too high a flame. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Adler

customer_reviews.title: Dented
customer_reviews.text: I was planning to cook with this today... Pan came in dented in multiple places. Contacting support in the hopes they will help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: just right for what I needed. Skillet is large enough to fit my widest burner, right amount of weight to the pan and cleans easily. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: kendra

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is currently my favorite pan! It's versatile and pretty easy to clean. It's fairly heavy so it doesn't feel cheap. It's also pretty large so you can fit a lot in it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a very good bargain. We've had this for almost six months and it has held up pretty well so far. We did read the instructions. We don't cook it at high heat (we don't anyways) and it's too big for the dishwasher anyway, ha! But this works great for cooking for the whole family and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Vel

customer_reviews.title: Best pan, Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I really regret not purchasing this sooner. It's perfection. It can do so much & replace so many other pots & pans. It's enormous, larger than my burner, but it still heats up evenly! It fits so much inside its insane. The long handle actually stays cool, much to my surprise. The short handle and lid handle can get a little hot, but not terrible. It's really rock solid. I used it 4x in 1 day when I first got it. Its my go-to now. Really a must have. You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lavach-Savy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pan!
customer_reviews.text: Great size! We followed instructions and never put it on high heat. Cleans easily. Perfect pan
customer_reviews.author: J Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Happy with all my Cuisinart purchases so far.
customer_reviews.text: It is somewhat heavy, so I love they have 2 handles to carry it. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe Gal

customer_reviews.title: ... have purchase two of these pans and was very satisfied with both of them
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase two of these pans and was very satisfied with both of them. It really helps hold the larger sized meals that I cook for our family of 6. They clean up very nicely and don`t show any signs of wear. I keep it clean with. Cuisinart has a nice warranty as well.
customer_reviews.author: Team Rogers

customer_reviews.title: To many varieties of the same product.
customer_reviews.text: A nice product, but there are so many models you never know what you'll get. Do your research.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Another 5-Star
customer_reviews.text: We live on spaghetti and often make a large batch for either company or leftovers. Our old pan was scraped and I was afraid we were poisoning ourselves with flakes of non-stick chemicals. This stainless steel pan works great - we have the 5-1/2 quart size. It's very high quality. The handle is long which is nice for cooking and when carrying the pan when it is full. It might make washing up a little harder unless you have a wide sink like we do. But I highly recommend this pan and lid! Epecially for about 50 bucks. What a deal
customer_reviews.author: Kerrabella

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. We used it as soon as we received it to make a stir fry dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Parkin

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan
customer_reviews.text: I have a whole set of Cuisinart Stainless steel pots and pans, but I needed a larger one and bought this one. It is the same design as my set. I love this pan, because I need pans that can go from the stove top to the broiler. These are great for that. Also, they are easy to clean, and my old set has lasted me forever.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works for all
customer_reviews.text: I got this item to replace all other pots/pans. I have been using it for a while and since had not needed another pot/pan. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: E Midiri

customer_reviews.title: very good pan
customer_reviews.text: The stainless steele pan is very good, and the price is okay.
customer_reviews.author: SebastianUSA

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, high quality, it cooks evenly, the lid fits snugly, is easy to clean, is pretty to look at, my wife is glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: NewMidwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality super nice very good deal and it comes with a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, beautiful, even heat distribution, easy to clean and the perfect size. The heavy duty bottom makes cooking a whole new experience but it's not too heavy that I have to struggle when it's full. I thought about getting a cast iron pan but I can hardly lift them even before I put in any food. Since this was on sale I figured I would take a chance and am so happy I did! I will be buying more of this line. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself A favor: buy quality pans
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, longer lasting than a non-stick coating, handle won’t start to wobble when cheap screws come loose, flat bottom is easy to stir and manage cooking, looks classy.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful quality & cleans easily!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. I cook a lot and use olive oil. I find that it is easy to clean, so things don't stick much. The bottom is flat, which helps with cooking fried eggs ... My last pan's handle got loose & the rivet was torn and it looked as though the heavy pan could fall off .... this handle is on strongly. The size is excellent for cooking and then moving food off to the side to cook something else ... Beautiful pan!
customer_reviews.author: rural girl

customer_reviews.title: Great pan, arrived dented.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this pan for a few months now. It is very big, I cooked about 20 chicken wings in it at one time (they were a bit overcrowded, but still). The only negative thing I can say about this pan is that it came with a small, dime-sized dent on the side. My husband was so anxious to use it, we decided just to keep it rather than sending it back with hopes that a different one would arrive in better condition. As far as I can tell, the dent doesn't affect the taste of the food, it just would have been nice to get the pan in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: TButler

customer_reviews.title: Best Stainless Steel Saute pan for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and put to use right away. Heavy-duty body and the lid fits. You can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: NO1UNO

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Like this pan but it’s really heavy specially with food! I have moderated to severe arthritis. I cannot use this only if someone is home to help me lift pan.
customer_reviews.author: CBhope

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and big
customer_reviews.text: It’s very huge but it cooks very well . If you don’t cook that much quantity then I would not recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Tulasi chaganti

customer_reviews.title: happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Great pan, I've used it a couple of times to simmer some one pan meals and have had great results with it. It heats evenly, is strong and durable, and no food sticking or burning. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Induction Cooktop Ready
customer_reviews.text: Induction Cooktop Ready! Says right on the bottom of the pan. Love it. Big enough to Cook a meal for the whole family
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Cuisanart 5-1/2-Quart Saute Pan
customer_reviews.text: I own many Cuisinart products. This sauté pan is a handy size. All of my Cuisinart pots and pans have the same qualities. They are even heating and easy to clean. Don't use abrasives. Clean by soaking with soapy water for a few minutes, then use BonAmi or Barkeepers friend on a DAMP paper towel or sponge. You'll be down to the shine in no time.
customer_reviews.author: evie Porter

customer_reviews.title: It's a pan, it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I no longer spill meat and sauce when I make pasta dishes when I stir the meat sauce. Heavy pan and when full of a sauce don't try to lift it, instead use a ladle or cup to spoon the sauce out until able to lift the pan comfortably. I had been looking for a high straight sided pan able to build my sauces in and this pan is my solution.
customer_reviews.author: gordon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a gift. Rated 5 stars based on what I heard from person who recieved it. Besides that I can't rate the performance of the pan. Perfect gift and it did come with all parts in tact and unbroken.
customer_reviews.author: brandon brown

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pan. Wife absolutely loves it (and I do too). Great that it has two handles. Always easy to clean, even after messy/sticky sautee'ing. I have to agree with other's comments, though, that the packaging could be better. Mine arrived in perfect condition, but I could see how it could easily get damaged due to the limited protection provided by the bare box. To Amazon: Just because it's not "breakable" doesn't mean it can't get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: a great steel pan
customer_reviews.text: Easily discolors and it has some hot spots. Just keep the heat turned medium or lower, keep oil distributed, and it's a great steel pan.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Heat Distribution
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed because I purchased a large pan to be able to fry more at a time. Unfortunately the pan is so large that the edge temperature never became consistent with the rest of the pan. Although, looks good and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Val's List

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart pan
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a large frying pan and it works beautifully. Due to its generous size I’m able to place enough in the pan at same time to feed four people.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

customer_reviews.title: This saute pan is great! It is also induction compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I totally like this saute pan. It is large enough to cook any dish. It is easy to clean and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Clean
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I loved this pot. The size is perfect. it been very hard to clean! I used it couple times now and no matter how much I clean it, it will not make it spotless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my old skillet was wearing out. It was lined with a non-stick coating. This is a great pan and I haven't had anything stick to it. It also cleans up well. It still looks new. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J.P

customer_reviews.title: sometimes it sticks but u just gotta have enough oil ...
customer_reviews.text: sometimes it sticks but u just gotta have enough oil, and not have it on too high a temp as this will get really hot and hold heat and therefore not need a high temp to cook something through. i always soak mine for about 15 min or overnight and everything comes right off really well!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking on America's Test Kitchen while they were rating saute pans and this was one of them. I was blown away when I saw the prize of this one on Amazon. I had to get it. It is a nice size. Very roomy and deep. If you have a small stove, or oven it may take up too much room. I love it. I also like the fact that it's stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Marlen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan for Deep Dish cuisine
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, you need a deeper sauté pan for dishes like smothered pork chops...this pan is perfect. Preheat it, and cleanup is as simple as teflon without the teflon becoming part of the meal. See my other reviews on Cusinart. I'm sold, and will buy no other cookware unless they don't have it.
customer_reviews.author: JBWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great skillet!
customer_reviews.text: Love this line of cookware! So easy to clean! Haven't had a problem with heating evenly. Like that it super large, cooking for a family of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Luce

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and clean ups a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it goes from stovetop to oven. The stay cool handle is great too!
customer_reviews.author: SmartMom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but bit heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Quality is great. The only drawback is, we feel its bit heavy when we try to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for the $
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on the advice of EWG to use stainless as an alternative to non stick. It works fine and cleans up well. Food cooks evenly on our propane gas stove, and the lid fits well. I am a little concerned about what one reviewer wrote about its not being made of real stainless steel. How do you find out what exactly its content is????
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to cook, I just dont like that food sticks to pan & makes it harder to clean. But overall good buy, I use it often.
customer_reviews.author: John Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Heats evenly!
customer_reviews.text: This was JUST what I was looking for to replace my big Wal-Mart non-stick pan. What I wasn't expecting was it to heat so evenly! The long handle has never gotten hot and the helper handle usually stays cool, though it has gotten hot on a few occasions (usually when there are other things cooking on the stove with it). The quality on this is outstanding, which isn't a surprise since it is Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Beers

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: We've had the pan for over a month now and we love it. It gets hot quickly and we've started using it more. The first time we used it my wife thought it stained the finish but after a quick wipe with some "Bartenders" cleaner and a scratch free pad it looked like new again. It takes a couple of minutes to clean after each use but it looks just like it did when we pulled it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Forever skillet
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it would be hard to clean, but it is very easy. This is a forever pan. I have a a set of stainless pots and pans that I've had 40 years. They are as good as new. Forget fads.
customer_reviews.author: SUZY

customer_reviews.title: warped
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pan several times, but it is warped and won't sear meat or anything. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G Smith

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd Cuisinart puchases
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan. I saute and steam and braise with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Van Dyke

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Great pan for a variety of uses. I was surprised that it doesn't stick or stain as much as other stainless steel cookware that I've purchased. We use this pan almost daily to sauté vegetables and cook stocks. After a few weeks of use, it still looks good as new. Very happy with this purchase.. Oh! And it's PFOA free too ;)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price Great cookware
customer_reviews.text: Look around for a saute pan at the local places and found cheaply made pans a box stores or expensive pans at the mall. I needed a pan big enough to cook a pound of bacon or fry a whole chicken a few times a year. It heats well and cooks well. The clean up is easy. The only thing I wish it had was a glass lid but the stainless steel lid seals well and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: W Morris

customer_reviews.title: This has become my favorite pan for cooking a large amount of one dish ...
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite pan for cooking a large amount of one dish wonders. It transfers to the oven without concern. It will be handed down in my family!
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Does everything expected at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pan for frying wings/pork chops without warping. Has filled that role as well as making sauces quite well. Great heat distribution, cleans up nicely. Great performance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Bromley

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well and easy to clean, but not perfectly flat.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these pans and absolutely love them. The only issue is that the bottom is not quite perfectly flat, so I have to keep moving the pan when I first put in my oil to make sure it doesn't pool. These pans keep an even temperature and are solidly built but still light enough to easily maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works well too
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and works well too. I had a pretty messy pan after cooking but cleaning what looked like a permanent mess came clean with ease.
customer_reviews.author: mdcowboys@aol.com

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a gift, was told is was great to use. Might buy one for myself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pan
customer_reviews.text: Expected a brand new pan to stick. Made pasta on my gas stove top that turned out like lasagna. Simmered evenly without burning. Only had to wipe out with warm soap and water. Beautiful to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is a great way to brown several pounds of hamburger at once or fix a large meal for several people. It cleans up easily. I plan on purchasing these for future gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Lora

product_meta.title: Cuisinart 733-30H Chef's Classic Stainless 5-1/2-Quart Saute Pan with Helper Handle and Cover, Silver
product_meta.description: The 5.5 quart sauté pan with helper handle & cover is a supremely versatile pan with high, Straight sides and the flat cooking surface to maximize capacity. Sear meats, poultry and more; cover to simmer for a perfect finish with convenient measurement markings so you know exactly how much food you are preparing. Features: Induction-ready|Mirror finish. Classic looks professional performance.|Aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots.|Stainless steel cooking surface does not discolor react with food or alter flavors|Measurement markings for ease of use|Cool Grip Helper Handle provides extra support and balance when lifting and pouring|Drip-Free Pouring|Flavor Lock Lid|Dishwasher Safe|Lifetime Warranty
feature_bullets: Chef's choice stainless: mirror finish. Classic looks, professional performance.
Unsurpassed heat distribution: aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots.

Stainless steel for professional results: stainless steel cooking surface does not Discolor, react with food or alter flavors. Great for classic cooking techniques like slow simmers, rolling boils and reduction of liquids.
Cool grip handle: Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop. A helper handle provides extra support and balance when lifting and pouring.
Drip-free pouring: rim is tapered for drip-free pouring.
Flavor lock lid: tight-fitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results, every time you cook.
Dishwasher safe: premium stainless steel easily cleans to original brilliant finish.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
